citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The last semiannual review of the facility's program for the humane care and use of animals occurred on November 10,
2023, slightly over 7 months before this inspection. The committee's semiannual review of the program ensures that the
IACUC is informed of the facility practices and approves of the program. The facility must ensure that the IACUC performs
semi annual reviews of the animal care and use program.
Correct by August 2024.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The last semi annual inspection was performed in November 10, 2023. Semi annual inspections are required every 6
months, to ensure that the IACUC is informed and approves of the condition of the housing and support areas for the
animals. The facility must ensure that the inspections are performed on a 6 month basis.
Correct by August 2024.

A section of the plastic and metal siding of the wall of the left outdoor exercise pen has been chewed and damaged by the
dogs in an area of approximately 18 x 6 inches. Rough edges and the exposed foundation of the building present an
injury hazard to the dogs. The facility must ensure that the exercise pens are kept in good repair and protect the animals
from injury.

The floors of the dog housing room are significantly worn in multiple areas under the raised floors of the primary
enclosures, with multiple layers of paint/fiberglass/surfacing exposed and coming off. These floors come into contact with
urine and feces, and cannot be properly cleaned and sanitized due to the many damaged layers of material present. The
facility must ensure that the surfaces can be readily cleaned and sanitized.
Correct by August 11, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.31(c)(1) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The last semiannual review of the facility's program for the humane care and use of animals occurred on November 10, 
2023, slightly over 7 months before this inspection. The committee's semiannual review of the program ensures that the 
IACUC is informed of the facility practices and approves of the program. The facility must ensure that the IACUC performs 
semi annual reviews of the animal care and use program. 
 
Correct by August 2024. 
2.31(c)(2) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The last semi annual inspection was performed in November 10, 2023. Semi annual inspections are required every 6 
months, to ensure that the IACUC is informed and approves of the condition of the housing and support areas for the 
animals. The facility must ensure that the inspections are performed on a 6 month basis. 
 
Correct by August 2024. 
3.1(a)  Repeat
   
Housing facilities, general. 
A section of the plastic and metal siding of the wall of the left outdoor exercise pen has been chewed and damaged by the 
dogs in an area of approximately 18 x 6 inches. Rough edges and the exposed foundation of the building present an 
injury hazard to the dogs. The facility must ensure that the exercise pens are kept in good repair and protect the animals 
from injury. 
3.1(c)(2) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
The floors of the dog housing room are significantly worn in multiple areas under the raised floors of the primary 
enclosures, with multiple layers of paint/fiberglass/surfacing exposed and coming off. These floors come into contact with 
urine and feces, and cannot be properly cleaned and sanitized due to the many damaged layers of material present. The

facility must ensure that the surfaces can be readily cleaned and sanitized. 
 
Correct by August 11, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
